metadata.title: CVE-2022-3058 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in Sign-In Flow in Google Chrome prior to 105.0.5195.52allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to engage in specific UIinteractions to potentially exploit heap corruption via crafted UIinteraction.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3058` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 105.0.5195.102-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 105.0.5195.102-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 105.0.5195.102-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 105.0.5195.102-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 105.0.5195.102-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '105.0.5195.102-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
